page.title: 01Concise Description.
page.content: This attractive rural area of low agricultural productivity has the out- skirts of Bordon and Liphook villages in the NW and SE corners respectively. A token of the once Royal Woolmer Forest remains in the SW now an army firing range. The river Wey with evidence of former mills and water meadows flows NW providing fine settings for houses near Bramshott and the ford at Standford. Centrally, Passfield lies scattered either side of the river. Conford, off B3004,is enveloped in National Trust areas of Conford Moor and Passfield Common,its stream the Hollywater. Houses in scattered groups, country lanes, oak trees, generous footpaths and bridleways feature. Farming: mostly grazing,horses,cattle. Topics: Conservation, Horses, Orchids, Bakery, Plastics factory, Church life.
